SOFA score label

label_sofa.Rd

The SOFA (Sequential Organ Failure Assessment) score is a commonly used assessment tool used to track a patient's well-being in an ICU.

sofa_data(
  source,
  pafi_win_length = hours(2L),
  pafi_mode = c("match_vals", "extreme_vals", "fill_gaps"),
  fix_na_fio2 = TRUE,
  vent_win_length = hours(6L),
  vent_min_win = mins(10L),
  gcs_win_length = hours(6L),
  fix_na_gcs = TRUE,
  urine_min_win = hours(12L),
  icu_limits = stay_windows(source, id_type, interval = interval),
  id_type = "icustay",
  interval = hours(1L),
  dictionary = read_dictionary(source),
  ...
)

sofa_window(
  tbl,
  pafi_win_fun = min_or_na,
  coag_win_fun = min_or_na,
  bili_win_fun = max_or_na,
  map_win_fun = min_or_na,
  dopa_win_fun = max_or_na,
  norepi_win_fun = max_or_na,
  dobu_win_fun = max_or_na,
  epi_win_fun = max_or_na,
  gcs_win_fun = min_or_na,
  crea_win_fun = max_or_na,
  urine_win_fun = min_or_na,
  explicit_wins = FALSE,
  worst_win_length = hours(24L)
)

sofa_compute(
  tbl,
  na_val = 0L,
  na_val_resp = na_val,
  na_val_coag = na_val,
  na_val_liver = na_val,
  na_val_cardio = na_val,
  na_val_cns = na_val,
  na_val_renal = na_val,
  impute_fun = NULL
)

sofa(source, ...)

Arguments

source

String valued name of data source
pafi_win_length

Time-span during which matching of PaO2 and FiO2 values is allowed
pafi_mode

Method for matching PaO2 and FiO2 values
fix_na_fio2

Logical flag indicating whether to impute missing FiO2 values with 21
vent_win_length

Default ventilation window if no stop time can be matched to a start time
vent_min_win

Minimal time span between a ventilation start and end time
gcs_win_length

Maximal time window for which a GCS value is valid if no newer measurement is available
fix_na_gcs

Logical flag controlling imputation of missing GCS values with the respective maximum values
urine_min_win

Minimal time span required for calculation of urine/24h
icu_limits

ICU stay durations used for calculating urine output
id_type

String specifying the patient id type to return
interval

The time interval used to discretize time stamps with, specified as base::difftime() object
dictionary

dictionary object to use for concept lookup
...

Passed to load_concepts()
tbl

ts_tbl object to use for label computations
pafi_win_fun, coag_win_fun, bili_win_fun, map_win_fun, dopa_win_fun, norepi_win_fun, dobu_win_fun, epi_win_fun, gcs_win_fun, crea_win_fun, urine_win_fun

functions used to calculate worst values over windows
explicit_wins

The default FALSE iterates over all time steps, TRUE uses only the last time step per patient and a vector of times will iterate over these explicit time points
worst_win_length

Time-frame to look back and apply the *_win_funs
na_val

Value to use for missing data
na_val_resp, na_val_coag, na_val_liver, na_val_cardio, na_val_cns, na_val_renal

Feature-specific values to use in case of missing data; default is na_val
impute_fun

Function used to impute missing data; default is NULL

Details

The SOFA score (Vincent et. al.) is evaluated as follows:

For each component, the worst value over a window of length worst_win_length (default hours(24L)) is taken.

The respiratory component of the SOFA score requires the evaluation of the PaO2/FiO2 ratio. Often, however, both measures are not available at the same time point. Therefore, PaO2 and FiO2 measurements are matched within a window of size pafi_win_length (default hours(2L)).

The renal component of the SOFA score assigns scores of 3 and 4 in case of a very low urine output. Since the information on urine output is not very reliable at the start of the ICU stay, we do not evaluate urine outputs before a time window of urine_min_win (default hours(12L)).

Mechanical ventilation is also part of the SOFA score. In some datasets, ventilation start events are given, which cannot be matched to ventilation end events specifically. In these cases, the duration of the ventilation window is taken to be vent_win_length (default hours(6L)).
